io.atomix

Class Atomix

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.atomix.Atomix
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ResourceManager<Atomix>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AtomixClient, AtomixReplica

    public abstract class Atomix
extends Object
implements ResourceManager<Atomix>
    Base type for creating and managing distributed resources in a Atomix cluster.

    Resources are user provided stateful objects backed by a distributed state machine. This class facilitates the creation and management of Resource objects via a filesystem like interface. There is a one-to-one relationship between keys and resources, so each key can be associated with one and only one resource.

    To create a resource, pass the resource Class to the getResource(String, ResourceType) method. When a resource is created, the StateMachine associated with the resource will be created on each Raft server and future operations submitted for that resource will be applied to the state machine. Internally, resource state machines are multiplexed across a shared Raft log.

    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

    • Method Detail

      • context

        public ThreadContext context()
        Description copied from interface: ResourceManager
        Returns the Atomix thread context.

        This context is representative of the thread on which asynchronous callbacks will be executed for this Atomix instance. Atomix guarantees that all CompletableFutures supplied by this instance will be executed via the returned context. Users can use the context to access the thread-local Serializer.

        Specified by:
        context in interface ResourceManager<Atomix>
        Returns:
        The Atomix thread context.

      • serializer

        public Serializer serializer()
        Returns the Atomix serializer.

        Serializable types registered on the returned serializer are reflected throughout the system. Types registered on a client must also be registered on all replicas to be transported across the wire.

        Specified by:
        serializer in interface ResourceManager<Atomix>
        Returns:
        The Atomix serializer.

      • getMap

        public <K,V> CompletableFuture<DistributedMap<K,V>> getMap(String key)
        Gets or creates a distributed map with default configuration and options.

        The returned DistributedMap replicates and stores map entries in memory in a HashMap. The size of the map is limited by the memory available to the smallest replica in the cluster. The map requires non-null keys but allows null values.

        Map key and value types must be serializable with the local Atomix instance Serializer and all AtomixReplica instances. By default, all primitives and most collections are serializable. For custom classes, users must Serializer.register(Class) serializable types before constructing the map.

        If no map exists at the given key, a new map will be created. If a map with the given key already exists, a reference to the map will be returned in the CompletableFuture. The map can be accessed by any AtomixClient or AtomixReplica in the cluster.

        Once the returned CompletableFuture is completed successfully, the map is guaranteed to be visible by all clients and replicas in the cluster.

        Type Parameters:
        K - The map key type.
        V - The map value type.
        Parameters:
        key - The resource key.
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the map has been created.

      • getMap

        public <K,V> CompletableFuture<DistributedMap<K,V>> getMap(String key,
                                                           Resource.Config config)
        Gets or creates a distributed map with a cluster-wide configuration.

        The returned DistributedMap replicates and stores map entries in memory in a HashMap. The size of the map is limited by the memory available to the smallest replica in the cluster. The map requires non-null keys but allows null values.

        Map key and value types must be serializable with the local Atomix instance Serializer and all AtomixReplica instances. By default, all primitives and most collections are serializable. For custom classes, users must Serializer.register(Class) serializable types before constructing the map.

        If no map exists at the given key, a new map will be created. If a map with the given key already exists, a reference to the map will be returned in the CompletableFuture. The map can be accessed by any AtomixClient or AtomixReplica in the cluster.

        Once the returned CompletableFuture is completed successfully, the map is guaranteed to be visible by all clients and replicas in the cluster.

        The provided map Config will be used to configure the cluster-wide map. If another process previously configured the map with a different configuration, that configuration will be overridden for all clients and replicas.

        Type Parameters:
        K - The map key type.
        V - The map value type.
        Parameters:
        key - The resource key.
        config - The cluster-wide map configuration.
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the map has been created.

      • getMap

        public <K,V> CompletableFuture<DistributedMap<K,V>> getMap(String key,
                                                           Resource.Options options)
        Gets or creates a distributed map with local options.

        The returned DistributedMap replicates and stores map entries in memory in a HashMap. The size of the map is limited by the memory available to the smallest replica in the cluster. The map requires non-null keys but allows null values.

        Map key and value types must be serializable with the local Atomix instance Serializer and all AtomixReplica instances. By default, all primitives and most collections are serializable. For custom classes, users must Serializer.register(Class) serializable types before constructing the map.

        If no map exists at the given key, a new map will be created. If a map with the given key already exists, a reference to the map will be returned in the CompletableFuture. The map can be accessed by any AtomixClient or AtomixReplica in the cluster.

        Once the returned CompletableFuture is completed successfully, the map is guaranteed to be visible by all clients and replicas in the cluster.

        The provided map options will be used to configure only the local map instance. Cluster-wide configurations can be performed by providing a Config.

        Type Parameters:
        K - The map key type.
        V - The map value type.
        Parameters:
        key - The resource key.
        options - The local map options.
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the map has been created.

        Gets or creates a distributed map with a cluster-wide configuration and local options.

        Map key and value types must be serializable with the local Atomix instance Serializer and all AtomixReplica instances. By default, all primitives and most collections are serializable. For custom classes, users must Serializer.register(Class) serializable types before constructing the map.

        If no map exists at the given key, a new map will be created. If a map with the given key already exists, a reference to the map will be returned in the CompletableFuture. The map can be accessed by any AtomixClient or AtomixReplica in the cluster.

        Once the returned CompletableFuture is completed successfully, the map is guaranteed to be visible by all clients and replicas in the cluster.

        The provided map Config will be used to configure the cluster-wide map. If another process previously configured the map with a different configuration, that configuration will be overridden for all clients and replicas.

        The provided map options will be used to configure only the local map instance. Cluster-wide configurations can be performed by providing a Config.

      • getMultiMap

        public <K,V> CompletableFuture<DistributedMultiMap<K,V>> getMultiMap(String key)
        Gets or creates a distributed multi map with default configuration and options.

        The multi-map is a map of keys to a collection of values. The order of value collections is dependent upon the map configuration. The map requires non-null keys but allows null values.

        Map key and value types must be serializable with the local Atomix instance Serializer and all AtomixReplica instances. By default, all primitives and most collections are serializable. For custom classes, users must Serializer.register(Class) serializable types before constructing the map.

        If no map exists at the given key, a new map will be created. If a map with the given key already exists, a reference to the map will be returned in the CompletableFuture. The map can be accessed by any AtomixClient or AtomixReplica in the cluster.

        Once the returned CompletableFuture is completed successfully, the map is guaranteed to be visible by all clients and replicas in the cluster.

        Type Parameters:
        K - The multi map key type.
        V - The multi map value type.
        Parameters:
        key - The resource key.
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the multi map has been created.

For custom classes, users must Serializer.register(Class) serializable types before constructing the map.

        The provided map Config will be used to configure the cluster-wide map. If another process previously configured the map with a different configuration, that configuration will be overridden for all clients and replicas.

        Gets or creates a distributed multi map with a cluster-wide configuration and local options.

        The multi-map is a map of keys to a collection of values. The order of value collections is dependent upon the map configuration. The map requires non-null keys but allows null values.

        Map key and value types must be serializable with the local Atomix instance Serializer and all AtomixReplica instances. By default, all primitives and most collections are serializable. For custom classes, users must Serializer.register(Class) serializable types before constructing the map.

        Once the returned CompletableFuture is completed successfully, the map is guaranteed to be visible by all clients and replicas in the cluster.

        The provided map Config will be used to configure the cluster-wide map. If another process previously configured the map with a different configuration, that configuration will be overridden for all clients and replicas.

        The provided map options will be used to configure only the local map instance. Cluster-wide configurations can be performed by providing a Config.

      • getSet

        public <T> CompletableFuture<DistributedSet<T>> getSet(String key)
        Gets or creates a distributed set with default configuration and options.

        The returned set replicates a unique set of values. Values must be non-null and must be serializable with the local Atomix instance Serializer and all AtomixReplica instances. By default, all primitives and most collections are serializable. For custom classes, users must Serializer.register(Class) serializable types before constructing the set.

        If no set exists at the given key, a new set will be created. If a set with the given key already exists, a reference to the set will be returned in the CompletableFuture. The set can be accessed by any AtomixClient or AtomixReplica in the cluster.

        Once the returned CompletableFuture is completed successfully, the set is guaranteed to be visible by all clients and replicas in the cluster.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The value type.
        Parameters:
        key - The resource key.
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the set has been created.

      • getSet

        public <T> CompletableFuture<DistributedSet<T>> getSet(String key,
                                                       Resource.Config config)
        Gets or creates a distributed set with a cluster-wide configuration.

        The returned set replicates a unique set of values. Values must be non-null and must be serializable with the local Atomix instance Serializer and all AtomixReplica instances. By default, all primitives and most collections are serializable. For custom classes, users must Serializer.register(Class) serializable types before constructing the set.

        If no set exists at the given key, a new set will be created. If a set with the given key already exists, a reference to the set will be returned in the CompletableFuture. The set can be accessed by any AtomixClient or AtomixReplica in the cluster.

        Once the returned CompletableFuture is completed successfully, the set is guaranteed to be visible by all clients and replicas in the cluster.

        The provided set Config will be used to configure the cluster-wide set. If another process previously configured the set with a different configuration, that configuration will be overridden for all clients and replicas.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The value type.
        Parameters:
        key - The resource key.
        config - The cluster-wide set configuration.

      • getQueue

        public <T> CompletableFuture<DistributedQueue<T>> getQueue(String key)
        Gets or creates a distributed queue with default configuration and options.

        The returned queue is backed by a replicated ArrayDeque. Queue values can be null. The size of the queue is limited by the amount of memory available to the smallest replica in the cluster.

        Queue value types must be serializable with the local Atomix instance Serializer and all AtomixReplica instances. By default, all primitives and most collections are serializable. For custom classes, users must Serializer.register(Class) serializable types before constructing the queue.

        If no queue exists at the given key, a new queue will be created. If a queue with the given key already exists, a reference to the queue will be returned in the CompletableFuture. The queue can be accessed by any AtomixClient or AtomixReplica in the cluster.

        Once the returned CompletableFuture is completed successfully, the queue is guaranteed to be visible by all clients and replicas in the cluster.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The value type.
        Parameters:
        key - The resource key.
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the queue has been created.

      • getQueue

        public <T> CompletableFuture<DistributedQueue<T>> getQueue(String key,
                                                           Resource.Config config)
        Gets or creates a distributed queue with a cluster-wide configuration.

        The returned queue is backed by a replicated ArrayDeque. Queue values can be null. The size of the queue is limited by the amount of memory available to the smallest replica in the cluster.

        Queue value types must be serializable with the local Atomix instance Serializer and all AtomixReplica instances. By default, all primitives and most collections are serializable. For custom classes, users must Serializer.register(Class) serializable types before constructing the queue.

        If no queue exists at the given key, a new queue will be created. If a queue with the given key already exists, a reference to the queue will be returned in the CompletableFuture. The queue can be accessed by any AtomixClient or AtomixReplica in the cluster.

        Once the returned CompletableFuture is completed successfully, the queue is guaranteed to be visible by all clients and replicas in the cluster.

        The provided queue Config will be used to configure the cluster-wide queue. If another process previously configured the queue with a different configuration, that configuration will be overridden for all clients and replicas.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The value type.
        Parameters:
        key - The resource key.
        config - The cluster-wide queue configuration.
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the queue has been created.

      • getQueue

        public <T> CompletableFuture<DistributedQueue<T>> getQueue(String key,
                                                           Resource.Options options)
        Gets or creates a distributed queue with local options.

        The returned queue is backed by a replicated ArrayDeque. Queue values can be null. The size of the queue is limited by the amount of memory available to the smallest replica in the cluster.

        Queue value types must be serializable with the local Atomix instance Serializer and all AtomixReplica instances. By default, all primitives and most collections are serializable. For custom classes, users must Serializer.register(Class) serializable types before constructing the queue.

        If no queue exists at the given key, a new queue will be created. If a queue with the given key already exists, a reference to the queue will be returned in the CompletableFuture. The queue can be accessed by any AtomixClient or AtomixReplica in the cluster.

        Once the returned CompletableFuture is completed successfully, the queue is guaranteed to be visible by all clients and replicas in the cluster.

        The provided queue options will be used to configure only the local queue instance. Cluster-wide configurations can be performed by providing a Config.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The value type.
        Parameters:
        key - The resource key.
        options - The local queue options.
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the queue has been created.

      • getQueue

        public <T> CompletableFuture<DistributedQueue<T>> getQueue(String key,
                                                           Resource.Config config,
                                                           Resource.Options options)
        Gets or creates a distributed queue with a cluster-wide configuration and local options.

        The returned queue is backed by a replicated ArrayDeque. Queue values can be null. The size of the queue is limited by the amount of memory available to the smallest replica in the cluster.

        Queue value types must be serializable with the local Atomix instance Serializer and all AtomixReplica instances. By default, all primitives and most collections are serializable. For custom classes, users must Serializer.register(Class) serializable types before constructing the queue.

        If no queue exists at the given key, a new queue will be created. If a queue with the given key already exists, a reference to the queue will be returned in the CompletableFuture. The queue can be accessed by any AtomixClient or AtomixReplica in the cluster.

        Once the returned CompletableFuture is completed successfully, the queue is guaranteed to be visible by all clients and replicas in the cluster.

        The provided queue Config will be used to configure the cluster-wide queue. If another process previously configured the queue with a different configuration, that configuration will be overridden for all clients and replicas.

        The provided queue options will be used to configure only the local queue instance. Cluster-wide configurations can be performed by providing a Config.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The value type.
        Parameters:
        key - The resource key.
        config - The cluster-wide queue configuration.
        options - The local queue options.
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the queue has been created.

      • getLong

        public CompletableFuture<DistributedLong> getLong(String key)
        Gets or creates a distributed long with default configuration and options.

        The returned resource is an asynchronous distributed object similar to AtomicLong. Operations that modify the value are guaranteed to be atomic, and changes to the state of the value are guaranteed to be visible by all clients and replicas when ReadConsistency.ATOMIC or ReadConsistency.ATOMIC_LEASE is enabled.

        If no long exists at the given key, a new long will be created. If a long with the given key already exists, a reference to the long will be returned in the CompletableFuture. The long can be accessed by any AtomixClient or AtomixReplica in the cluster.

        Once the returned CompletableFuture is completed successfully, the long is guaranteed to be visible by all clients and replicas in the cluster.

        Parameters:
        key - The resource key.
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the long has been created.

      • getLock

        public CompletableFuture<DistributedLock> getLock(String key)
        Gets or creates a distributed lock with default configuration and options.

        The returned resource is a cluster-wide distributed lock. The lock is fair, meaning the lock will be granted to the longest waiting process. In the event that a lock holder crashes or is partitioned, the lock will be automatically released once the lock holder's session expires, and the lock will be granted to the next process waiting in the lock queue.

        If no lock exists at the given key, a new lock will be created. If a lock with the given key already exists, a reference to the lock will be returned in the CompletableFuture. The lock can be accessed by any AtomixClient or AtomixReplica in the cluster.

        Once the returned CompletableFuture is completed successfully, the lock is guaranteed to be visible by all clients and replicas in the cluster.

        Parameters:
        key - The resource key.
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the lock has been created.

      • getLock

                                                  Resource.Config config)

      • getGroup

        public CompletableFuture<DistributedGroup> getGroup(String key)
        Gets or creates a distributed group for managing group membership and leader elections.

        The returned resource can be used to perform a variety of common distributed systems tasks, most notable of which are group membership and leader election. The DistributedGroup can be used to identify members of a group or to join a group. Members of the group are guaranteed to be consistent across all clients and replicas. If a member of the group is partitioned or fails, the member will be removed once its session expires.

        If no group exists at the given key, a new group will be created. If a group with the given key already exists, a reference to the group will be returned in the CompletableFuture. The group can be accessed by any AtomixClient or AtomixReplica in the cluster.

        Once the returned CompletableFuture is completed successfully, the group is guaranteed to be visible by all clients and replicas in the cluster.

        Parameters:
        key - The resource key.
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the group has been created.

      • exists

        public CompletableFuture<Boolean> exists(String key)
        Description copied from interface: ResourceManager
        Checks whether a resource exists with the given key.

        If no resource with the given key exists in the cluster, the returned CompletableFuture will be completed false. Note, however, that users should not significantly rely upon the existence or non-existence of a resource due to race conditions. While a resource may not exist when the returned future is completed, it may be created by another node shortly thereafter.

        This method returns a CompletableFuture which can be used to block until the operation completes or to be notified in a separate thread once the operation completes. To block until the operation completes, use the CompletableFuture.get() method: 

           
   if (!atomix.exists("lock").get()) {
     DistributedLock lock = atomix.getResource("lock", DistributedLock.class).get();
   }
        Alternatively, to execute the operation asynchronous and be notified once the result is received in a different thread, use one of the many completable future callbacks: 
           
   atomix.exists("lock").thenAccept(exists -> {
     if (!exists) {
       atomix.<DistributedLock>getResource("lock", DistributedLock.class).thenAccept(lock -> {
         ...
       });
     }
   });
        Specified by:
        exists in interface ResourceManager<Atomix>
        Parameters:
        key - The key to check.
        Returns:
        A completable future indicating whether the given key exists.

      • keys

        public CompletableFuture<Set<String>> keys()
        Description copied from interface: ResourceManager
        Returns keys of all existing resources.

        This method returns a CompletableFuture which can be used to block until the operation completes or to be notified in a separate thread once the operation completes. To block until the operation completes, use the CompletableFuture.get() method: 

           
   Collection<String> resourceKeys = atomix.keys().get();
        Alternatively, to execute the operation asynchronous and be notified once the result is received in a different thread, use one of the many completable future callbacks: 
           
   atomix.<Collection<String>>keys().thenAccept(resourceKeys -> {
     ...
   });
        Specified by:
        keys in interface ResourceManager<Atomix>
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed with the keys of all existing resources.

   Set<String> resourceKeys = atomix.keys(DistributedLock.class).get();
        Alternatively, to execute the operation asynchronous and be notified once the result is received in a different thread, use one of the many completable future callbacks:

     ...
   });

      • getResource

        public <T extends Resource> CompletableFuture<T> getResource(String key,
                                                             Class<? super T> type)
        Description copied from interface: ResourceManager
        Gets or creates the given resource and acquires a singleton reference to it.

        If a resource at the given key already exists, the resource will be validated to verify that its type matches the given type. If no resource yet exists, a new resource will be created in the cluster. Once the session for the resource has been opened, a resource instance will be returned.

        The returned Resource instance will be a singleton reference to an global instance for this node. That is, multiple calls to this method for the same resource will result in the same Resource instance being returned.

        This method returns a CompletableFuture which can be used to block until the operation completes or to be notified in a separate thread once the operation completes. To block until the operation completes, use the CompletableFuture.get() method: 

           
   DistributedLock lock = atomix.getResource("lock", DistributedLock.class).get();
        Alternatively, to execute the operation asynchronous and be notified once the result is received in a different thread, use one of the many completable future callbacks: 
           
   atomix.<DistributedLock>getResource("lock", DistributedLock.class).thenAccept(lock -> {
     ...
   });
        Specified by:
        getResource in interface ResourceManager<Atomix>
        Type Parameters:
        T - The resource type.
        Parameters:
        key - The key at which to get the resource.
        type - The expected resource type.
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the resource has been loaded.

      • getResource

        public <T extends Resource> CompletableFuture<T> getResource(String key,
                                                             Class<? super T> type,
                                                             Resource.Config config)
        Description copied from interface: ResourceManager
        Gets or creates the given resource and acquires a singleton reference to it.

        If a resource at the given key already exists, the resource will be validated to verify that its type matches the given type. If no resource yet exists, a new resource will be created in the cluster. Once the session for the resource has been opened, a resource instance will be returned.

        The returned Resource instance will be a singleton reference to an global instance for this node. That is, multiple calls to this method for the same resource will result in the same Resource instance being returned.

        This method returns a CompletableFuture which can be used to block until the operation completes or to be notified in a separate thread once the operation completes. To block until the operation completes, use the CompletableFuture.get() method: 

           
   DistributedLock lock = atomix.getResource("lock", DistributedLock.class).get();
        Alternatively, to execute the operation asynchronous and be notified once the result is received in a different thread, use one of the many completable future callbacks:

     ...
   });
        Specified by:
        getResource in interface ResourceManager<Atomix>

      • getResource

        public <T extends Resource> CompletableFuture<T> getResource(String key,
                                                             Class<? super T> type,
                                                             Resource.Options options)
        Description copied from interface: ResourceManager
        Gets or creates the given resource and acquires a singleton reference to it.

        If a resource at the given key already exists, the resource will be validated to verify that its type matches the given type. If no resource yet exists, a new resource will be created in the cluster. Once the session for the resource has been opened, a resource instance will be returned.

        The returned Resource instance will be a singleton reference to an global instance for this node. That is, multiple calls to this method for the same resource will result in the same Resource instance being returned.

        This method returns a CompletableFuture which can be used to block until the operation completes or to be notified in a separate thread once the operation completes. To block until the operation completes, use the CompletableFuture.get() method: 

           
   DistributedLock lock = atomix.getResource("lock", DistributedLock.class).get();
        Alternatively, to execute the operation asynchronous and be notified once the result is received in a different thread, use one of the many completable future callbacks: 
           
   atomix.<DistributedLock>getResource("lock", DistributedLock.class).thenAccept(lock -> {
     ...
   });
        Specified by:
        getResource in interface ResourceManager<Atomix>
        Type Parameters:
        T - The resource type.
        Parameters:
        key - The key at which to get the resource.
        type - The expected resource type.
        options - The local resource options.
        Returns:
        A completable future to be completed once the resource has been loaded.
